page.title: 12Shopping facilities (p.1.)
page.content: The only shops in this block are found in Wrea Green village. There are five :- a greengrocer, a Post Office and general store, a grocer, a hairdresser and a cafe. In the grocery department of the Post Office's general store a pint of milk costs 23 pence, a lettuce 20p, a pound of butter 98p, a large white loaf 36p,and a tin of tomato soup 25p. This shop is visited most frequently by parents of children in the school. The most popular Newspaper bought here is the Â£Daily Express'. The village grocer's shop is owned by 3 brothers who a few years ago won the B.B.C. National Shopkeeper of the Year competition. The shop is popular because of the friendly and cheerful personalities of the owners. They will deliver grocery orders to the houses of old people who can't get out.
